titles.title: A resolution to express the sense of the Senate that all able-bodied Federal prison inmates should work and that the Attorney General shall submit to Congress a report describing a strategy for employing more Federal prison inmates.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

bill.summary: 11/16/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) all able-bodied Federal prison inmates should work; and (2) the Attorney General shall submit to the Congress a report describing a strategy for employing more Federal prison inmates. Requires such report to focus on: (1) the creation of new job opportunities for such inmates; (2) the degree to which any expansion of lines of business of Federal Prison Industries (FPI) may adversely affect the private sector or displace domestic labor; and (3) the degree to which opportunities for partnership between FPI and small business can be fostered.
